definition: to expand/to push sth with the hand/to develop/to open up
to make a rubbing (e.g. of an inscription)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Which will have started to taste like a sourdough .
sentences.chinese: 这将开始一个拓荒者的味道。
请把贫民窟的人看成拓荒者。

sentences.english: The exploiter would carry away his prophesy of harvest.
sentences.chinese: 拓荒者将带走收获的预言。

sentences.english: CABIN】The pioneers lived in a cabin in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 拓荒者住在森林里的一间小屋内。

sentences.english: A heavy stockade around the cabin protected the pioneer from attack.
sentences.chinese: 小屋周围的厚厚的栅栏保护拓荒者免受攻击。

sentences.english: Hong Shen is one of the modern drama explorers of our country.
sentences.chinese: 洪深是我国现代戏剧事业的拓荒者之一。

sentences.english: Many pioneers have left their deep footprints in the wind and rain;
sentences.chinese: 多少拓荒者在风雨中留下深深浅浅的脚印。

sentences.english: Qiu Zihua is the pathbreaker of oriental aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 邱紫华先生是东方美学的拓荒者。

sentences.english: The pioneers endured many hardships in setting the west.
sentences.chinese: 那些拓荒者在开发西部时历经了千辛万苦。

sentences.english: The pioneers were individualists. And theydid stand the gaff .
sentences.chinese: 拓荒者们是个人主义者，他们也确实有这份胆量。

sentences.english: He was known as a frontiersman from the state of Tennessee.
sentences.chinese: 当时大家都知道他是一位来自田纳西州的拓荒者。

sentences.english: This books opens the door to a very simple approach to sourdough .
sentences.chinese: 此书籍开启了大门，一个非常简单的方法来拓荒者。

sentences.english: The history of public education in the United States dates from the society of the early pioneers.
sentences.chinese: 美国的公共教育史起源于早期拓荒者的社会。

sentences.english: He was born in a Kentucky log cabin, the son of a typical pioneer family.
sentences.chinese: 他出生在肯塔基州的小木屋里，典型的拓荒者的儿子。

sentences.english: The reader is to enjoy the pioneers folly .
sentences.chinese: 读者要想充分领略《拓荒者》的意趣。

sentences.english: A heavy stockade around the cabins protected the pioneers from attack.
sentences.chinese: 小屋周围的厚厚的栅栏保护拓荒者免受攻击。

definition: the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
